page.title: 06 Babbington
page.content: Babbington is a small hamlet. It is a dead end, though it can be reached by footpaths and bridleways. The houses in Babbington were once miner's cottages. We talked to Mrs.Doolin who lives in one of the houses. Her house used to be called the pump house because it used to have a pump in the cellar which pumped water into a culvert. The water had to be pumped out of the mine to stop it flooding. The hamlet once had a{chapel which has been pulled down now. Although the{mine}has been closed for many years, people in the cottages still find pit shafts by their houses. These have to be capped by the coalboard, because they are dangerous.
